title: spicyWorkBook
text:
spicyWorkBook
Introduction of workflow, motivation for workflow, and authors.

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.

1 + 1

[1] 2






Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 2  Summary
text:
In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.

title: References
text:

title: 1  Overview
text:
To include: - Overview of datasets - Overview of motivations behind datasets, e.g. survival, metastasis, etc. - Overview of packages - Overview of which packages can be applied to which datasets - Hyperlinking?

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: 2  Processing
text:
Steps:

Format of images (TIFFs)
How to read in data (cytomapper)
How to segment data (simpleSeg)
How to segment data (BIDCell?)


1 + 1

[1] 2

title: 3  Quality Control
text:
Steps: 1. How to qc segmentation (simpleSeg/cellSPA?) 2. How to qc image batch-effect (simpleSeg::normalizeCells) 3. How to qc patient batch-effect (simpleSeg::normalizeCells)

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: 4  Cell Annotation
text:
Steps:

Rationale behind clustering vs annotation
How to cluster cells (FuseSOM)
How to annotate clusters (pheatmap)
How to annotate cells (scClassify)
How to select a reference dataset (scClassify)


1 + 1

[1] 2

title: 5  Differential Analysis
text:
Steps:

Differential proportions of cells (spicyR::getProp)
Differential localisation of cells (spicyR)
Differential region proportions (lisaClust)
Differential localisation of cells with respect to a parent (Kontextual)
Differential cell-cell interactions (SpatioMark)


1 + 1

[1] 2

title: 6  Survival Analysis
text:
Steps: 1. Association between survival and cell proportion (spicyR::colTest) 2. Association between survival and localisation (spicyR) 3. Association between survival and region proportions (lisaClust) 4. Association between survival and Kontextual features (Kontextual) 5. Association between survival and cell-cell interactions (SpatioMark)

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: 7  Survival Analysis
text:
Steps:

Motivation of classification (prediction)
Classification of patients by condition
Classification of patients by survival
Easy and Hard to classify patients (samplesMetricMap)
Maximising accuracy during classification (parameter tuning for crossValidate)
